Problem:

We examine the effects of an integral transform \\( I(x) = \\int x e^{-\\lambda t} dt \\), where \\( \\lambda \\) is also a constant, applied to the position \\( x(t) \\) of the particle.

Given the velocity \\( v(t) \\) at t = T, can we deduce the original position \\( x_0 \\) at t = 0 without knowing whether \\( I(x) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without the knowledge of the application of \\( I(x) \\), the original position \\( x_0 \\) remains indeterminable because the integral transformation could have modified the initial position in an irreversible manner, especially as the transformation involves integration over time with an exponential decay.
